'''Pudding Isle''' in the [[Golden Apple Archipelago/2.8|Golden Apple Archipelago]] during the [[Summertime Odyssey]] event.

After completing [[As the Courtyard in Spring Once Appeared (Part 3)]], two halves can be switched between three versions: [[Mondstadt]], [[Liyue]], and [[Inazuma]] by interacting with the bonsai.

==Puzzles==
===Electro Seelie and Elemental Monuments===
Three groups of [[Elemental Monument]]s can be found on Pudding Isle. The Anemo and Geo monuments are initially locked until the Electro monuments are solved.

When the left half of Pudding Isle is set to Inazuma style, an [[Electro Seelie]] can be found near the Electro Elemental Monuments. The Seelie's path of movement indicates the correct order of activating the Elemental Monuments.

Once the Electro Monuments are successfully activated, the Anemo and Geo monuments are unlocked, and switching the right half of Pudding Isle to Mondstadt or Liyue style while keeping the left half Inazuma style will cause the Electro Seelie to move in new patterns, which indicate the correct orders of activating the Anemo or Geo Monuments.

After all three sets of Elemental Monuments are activated, the Electro Seelie will now travel towards the bonsai when approached. Once it reaches its destination, the player is rewarded with a [[Precious Chest]].

{{Dialogue start}}
;(Approach the locked Anemo or Geo Monuments)
:'''Paimon:''' Huh, why are these elemental monuments all locked up? Are there others on other mountains?

;(Approach the Electro Monuments)
:'''Paimon:''' Wow, finally, an elemental monument that isn't sealed...

;(After solving the Electro Monuments)
:'''Paimon:''' Huh. We lit all the elemental monuments up, so why's this Electro Seelie still here?
;(If the right half is Mondstadt or Liyue style)
::'''Paimon:''' Uhh, this Electro Seelie's path is a little different from before. Does this have something to do with the elemental monuments on the other mountains?
;(If the right half is Inazuma style)
::'''Paimon:''' Hmm... What's this Electro Seelie doing just standing around here?
:;(Approach the Electro Seelie after changing the right half to Mondstadt or Liyue style)
::'''Paimon:''' Ooh! We've got that Electro Seelie moving again!
::'''Paimon:''' Still, this Electro Seelie's path through the air is a bit different from it was earlier... Does this have something to do with the elemental monuments on the other mountains?

;(After solving all three Monuments)
:'''Paimon:''' Alright, that's all the elemental monuments on the islands lit up. Let's go check that Electro Seelie on the Inazuma-style mountains!
{{Dialogue end}}

===Time Trial to Collect Elemental Particles===
There is a Time Trial to the north of the island about collecting Elemental Particles across the bridge. Depending on the bonsai setup, some part of the bridge might be broken. The easiest setup to complete the challenge is to set left half to Inazuma style and right half to Mondstadt style, which is hinted at by the colors of the particles.

{{Dialogue start}}
;(Failed the challenge for the 3rd time)
:'''Paimon:''' Grabbing Elemental Particles floating in mid-air is just way too tough...
:'''Paimon:''' But y'know, Paimon does remember that bridges can appear under floating particles in some situations. Might as well give that a go, huh, (Traveler)?
{{Dialogue end}}
